Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Dodgers play the Colorado Rockies with a 1-0 series lead.
Los Angeles is 92-62 overall and 49-27 at home.
Colorado has a 23-56 record on the road and a 59-95 record overall.
The matchup Saturday is the ninth time these teams match up this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockies have hit 172 total home runs to rank eighth in the NL.
Mookie Betts has 23 doubles, five triples, 17 home runs and 70 RBI for the Dodgers.
Shohei Ohtani is 15-for-42 with four doubles and six home runs over the past 10 games.
Brenton Doyle has 24 doubles, four triples and 22 home runs for the Rockies.
Ezequiel Tovar is 10-for-41 with a double and three home runs over the past 10 games.
Others: The Dodgers have a 6-2 advantage in the season series.
Walker Buehler (1-5, 5.54 ERA, 1.61 WHIP, 54 strikeouts) and Cal Quantrill (8-10, 4.68 ERA, 1.47 WHIP, 105 strikeouts) are the probable pitchers.
The betting line is Dodgers -277, Rockies +225; over/under is 8 1/2 runs.
